meanings.definition: A period of the Stone Age characterized by the development of agriculture and the use of polished stone tools.
meanings.sent1: During the neolith, people learned to farm and make tools from polished stones.
meanings.sent2: Archaeologists study the neolith to understand how early humans lived.
meanings.sent3: The neolith must have been an exciting time for inventing new tools.
meanings.sent4: In the neolith of human history, agriculture bloomed like a flower in spring.
meanings.sent5: The neolith era marked a significant shift in human civilization.

meanings.definition: A member of a prehistoric society from the Neolithic period.
meanings.sent1: The neoliths were skilled in crafting tools and cultivating crops.
meanings.sent2: Researchers found ancient artifacts left behind by neoliths.
meanings.sent3: Imagine a neolith trying to use modern technology - it would be quite amusing!
meanings.sent4: The neoliths were the pioneers of early human settlements.
meanings.sent5: Each neolith played a crucial role in the development of their community.

meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of the Neolithic period.
meanings.sent1: The neolith tools were more advanced than those of earlier periods.
meanings.sent2: The neolith architecture showed a shift towards settled communities.
meanings.sent3: Wearing neolith-inspired clothing to a modern party would be quite a fashion statement!
meanings.sent4: Her ideas were as groundbreaking as neolith innovations in agriculture.
meanings.sent5: The neolith lifestyle emphasized the importance of agriculture and community.
